description: This notification is generated when switch from working
PW to protect PW happens.

event.Summary: Switch state changed to protect PW due to $v3

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwPWVcSwitchWtoP HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwPWVcCtrlWord i 1 HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwPWVcSwitchRmtID u 9999 HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwPWVcStateChangeReason i 1 HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwPWVcIfName s EXAMPLE

description: If signaling is used for PW establishment, this object
indicates the status of the control word negotiation,
and in both signaling or manual configuration indicates
if CW is to be present or not for this PW.

description: This object indicates the VC ID of PW
switch between working PW and protect PW .

description: This object indicates the cause of the VC status change.

description: Name of the interface (or the virtual interface)
associated with the PW.
variables.name: HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwPWVcIfName

description: This notification is generated when switch from protect
PW to working PW happens.

event.Summary: Switch state changed back to working PW

description: The value of this object identifies the outgoing label value of a PW.

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the

description: This object indicates the tunnel type.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VPLS-EXT-MIB::hwL2vpnTnlType

description: This object indicates the mplsTunnelIndex.
It contains an unused value for
mplsTunnelIndex, or a zero to indicate
that none exist. Negative values are not allowed
as they do not correspond to valid values of
mplsTunnelIndex.
Note that this object offers an unused value
for an mplsTunnelIndex value at the ingress
side of a tunnel. At other LSRs the value
of mplsTunnelIndex SHOULD be taken from the
value signaled by the MPLS signaling protocol.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VPLS-EXT-MIB::hwL2vpnTunnelIndex

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcSwitchWtoP HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcID u 9999 HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcType i 1 HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcCtrlWord i 1 HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcStateChangeReason i 1 IF-MIB::ifName s EXAMPLE

description: Index for the conceptual row identifying a PW within
this PW Emulation table.Used in the outgoing PW ID field within the 'Virtual
Circuit FEC Element'.
variables.name: HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcID

description: Index for the conceptual row identifying a PW within
this PW Emulation table.This value indicate the service to be carried over
this PW.
variables.name: HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcType

description: If signaling is used for PW establishment, this object
indicates the status of the control word negotiation,
and in both signaling or manual configuration indicates
if CW is to be present or not for this PW.
variables.name: HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcCtrlWord

description: This object indicates the reason of PE VC
state change.
variables.name: HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcStateChangeReason

description: The textual name of the interface. The value of this
object should be the name of the interface as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name, such as `le0' or a simple port number, such as `1'
depending on the interface naming syntax of the device. If
several entries in the ifTable together represent a single
interface as named by the device, then each will have the
same value of ifName. Note that for an agent which responds
to SNMP queries concerning an interface on some other
(proxied) device, then the value of ifName for such an
interface is the proxied device's local name for it.
If there is no local name, or this object is otherwise not
applicable, then this object contains a zero-length string.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifName

description: This notification is generated when switch from protect
PW to working PW happens.Currently, can't support.

event.Summary: SVC ($v2) switch changed back to working PW

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcSwitchPtoW HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcID u 9999 HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcType i 1 HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcCtrlWord i 1 HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcStateChangeReason i 1 IF-MIB::ifName s EXAMPLE

description: Index for the conceptual row identifying a PW within
this PW Emulation table.Used in the outgoing PW ID field within the 'Virtual
Circuit FEC Element'.
variables.name: HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcID

description: Index for the conceptual row identifying a PW within
this PW Emulation table.This value indicate the service to be carried over
this PW.
variables.name: HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcType

description: If signaling is used for PW establishment, this object
indicates the status of the control word negotiation,
and in both signaling or manual configuration indicates
if CW is to be present or not for this PW.
variables.name: HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcCtrlWord

description: This object indicates the reason of PE VC
state change.
variables.name: HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcStateChangeReason

description: The textual name of the interface. The value of this
object should be the name of the interface as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name, such as `le0' or a simple port number, such as `1'
depending on the interface naming syntax of the device. If
several entries in the ifTable together represent a single
interface as named by the device, then each will have the
same value of ifName. Note that for an agent which responds
to SNMP queries concerning an interface on some other
(proxied) device, then the value of ifName for such an
interface is the proxied device's local name for it.
If there is no local name, or this object is otherwise not
applicable, then this object contains a zero-length string.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifName

description: This notification indicates the SVC's state changes to down.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcDown HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcID u 9999 HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcType i 1 HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcPeerAddr a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcInboundLabel u 9999 HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcOutboundLabel u 9999 HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcStateChangeReason i 1 IF-MIB::ifName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcTnlPolicyName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcActive i 1 HUAWEI-VPLS-EXT-MIB::hwL2vpnTnlType i 1 HUAWEI-VPLS-EXT-MIB::hwL2vpnTunnelIndex u 9999

state change.

object should be the name of the interface as assigned by

description: Indicates the tunnel policy name used.
variables.name: HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcTnlPolicyName

description: Denotes the current vc is active or not.
variables.name: HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwSvcActive

description: This object indicates the tunnel type.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VPLS-EXT-MIB::hwL2vpnTnlType

description: This object indicates the mplsTunnelIndex.
It contains an unused value for
mplsTunnelIndex, or a zero to indicate
that none exist. Negative values are not allowed
as they do not correspond to valid values of
mplsTunnelIndex.
Note that this object offers an unused value
for an mplsTunnelIndex value at the ingress
side of a tunnel. At other LSRs the value
of mplsTunnelIndex SHOULD be taken from the
value signaled by the MPLS signaling protocol.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VPLS-EXT-MIB::hwL2vpnTunnelIndex

description: This notification indicates the SVC's state changes to up.

variables.name: IF-MIB::ifName

description: This notification indicates the PWTemplate cannot be deleted.
The name of the PW template.
Set by the operator to indicate the protocol responsible
for establishing this PW. The value 'static' is used in all
cases where no maintenance protocol (PW signaling) is used
to set-up the PW, i.e. require configuration of entries in
the PW tables including PW labels, etc. The value 'ldp' is
used in case of signaling with the PWid FEC element with LDP
signaling. The value 'rsvp' indicate the use of rsvp
control protocol.
variables.name: HUAWEI-PWE3-MIB::hwPWTemplateName
